metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4658 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The vault subsystem in Ansible before 1.5.5 does not set the umask before creation or modification of a vault file, which allows local users to obtain sensitive key information by reading a file. It was discovered that Ansible did not properly set permissions upon creation or modification of a vault file. A local attacker could use this to obtain sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
ansible-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
ansible-node-fireball - 1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ansible package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.4+dfsg-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
